cards.title: Introduction
cards.body:
[GitHub Actions](https://docs.github.com/en/actions) is a CI/CD platform that enables automation of software workflows,
allowing developers to build, test, and deploy code right from their GitHub repositories.

cards.title: Workflow Files
cards.body:
Github Action Workflows are defined in special YAML files, typically stored in a `.github/workflows` directory in the
github repository.

cards.title: Workflow Files
cards.code:
name: hello-world
on: push
jobs:
  hello-world-job:
    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
    steps:
      - name: Hello World
        run: echo "Hello World!"

cards.title: Workflow Files
cards.body:
• On GitHub.com, navigate to the main page of the repository.
• Under your repository name, click `Actions`.
• In the left sidebar, click the workflow you want to display, in this example "hello-world"

cards.title: Workflow Syntax
cards.code:
name: learn-github-actions
run-name: ${{ github.actor }} is learning GitHub Actions
on: [push]
jobs:
  check-bats-version:
    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
    steps:
      - uses: actions/checkout@v4
      - uses: actions/setup-node@v3
        with:
          node-version: '14'
      - run: npm install -g bats
      - run: bats -v

cards.title: Workflow Syntax Descriptions
cards.back: Sets the name of the GitHub Actions workflow. It's a label used for identifying the workflow in the repository.

cards.title: Workflow Syntax Descriptions
cards.back: Sets a custom name for the run, using a GitHub context `${{ github.actor }}` to include the name of the user who initiated the run.

cards.title: Workflow Syntax Descriptions
cards.back: Specifies the event that triggers the workflow. In this case, the workflow is triggered on any `push` event to the repository.

cards.title: Workflow Syntax Descriptions
cards.back: Defines a group of jobs that will be executed as part of the workflow. Each job runs independently in the workflow.

cards.title: Workflow Syntax Descriptions
cards.back: Identifier for a specific job within the workflow. This job is named `check-bats-version`.

cards.title: Workflow Syntax Descriptions
cards.back: Specifies the type of machine to run the job on. Here, it's set to run on the latest version of Ubuntu.

cards.title: Workflow Syntax Descriptions
cards.back: Contains a sequence of tasks (steps) that will be executed as part of the job.

cards.title: Workflow Syntax Descriptions
cards.back: Used to specify an action to include as part of a step. For example, `actions/checkout@v4` checks out the repository, and `actions/setup-node@v3` sets up a Node environment.

cards.title: Workflow Syntax Descriptions
cards.back: Specifies additional parameters for the action. It's used in conjunction with `uses` to configure the action.

cards.title: Workflow Syntax Descriptions
cards.back: Contains parameter under `with`, specifying the version of Node.js to be set up by the `setup-node` action. In this case, it's set to version '14'.

cards.title: Steps
cards.code:
jobs:
  build:
    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
    steps:
      # step 1
      - name: Check out repository
        uses: actions/checkout@v2

      # step 2
      - name: Set up Node.js
        uses: actions/setup-node@v2
        with:
          node-version: '14'

      # step 3
      - name: Install dependencies
        run: npm install

      # step 4
      - name: Run tests
        run: npm test

cards.title: Secrets
cards.body:
To add a new secret in your github repository nagivate to `Repository` > `Settings` > `Security` >
`Secrets and Variables` > `Actions` > `New Repository Secret`

cards.title: Secrets
cards.code:
name: Workflow with Secrets

on: [push]

jobs:
  example_job:
    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
    steps:
      - name: Checkout repository
        uses: actions/checkout@v2
      - name: Use a secret
        run: echo "The secret is ${{ secrets.MY_SECRET }}"

cards.title: Artifacts
cards.body: To access your artifact navigate to `Repository` > `Actions` > `Workflow Run` > `Artifacts`

cards.title: Artifacts
cards.code:
jobs:
  build:
    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
    steps:
      - name: Build project
        run: make build
      - name: Upload build artifact
        uses: actions/upload-artifact@v3 # upload Artifacts prebuilt action
        with:
          name: my-artifact
          path: path/to/artifact

cards.title: Caching Dependencies
cards.body: Dependency caches stores downloaded packages or compiled binaries of your workflows.

cards.title: Caching Dependencies
cards.code:
jobs:
  build:
    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
    steps:
      - uses: actions/checkout@v2
      - name: Cache dependencies
        uses: actions/cache@v2 # stores downloaded packages or compiled binaries
        with:
          path: |
            path/to/dependencies
            another/path
          key: ${{ runner.os }}-deps-${{ hashFiles('**/lockfile') }} # hash of the dependency lock file is generated in the OS
      - name: Install dependencies
        run: install-command

cards.title: Matrix Strategies
cards.code:
jobs:
  build:
    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
    strategy:
      matrix:
        node-version: [12.x, 14.x, 16.x]
        # matrix strategy runs enables you to run jobs across multiple combinations of environments and OS's
        os: [ubuntu-latest, windows-latest, macOS-latest]
    steps:
      - uses: actions/checkout@v2
      - name: Use Node.js ${{ matrix.node-version }}
        uses: actions/setup-node@v1
        with:
          node-version: ${{ matrix.node-version }}
      - run: npm install
      - run: npm test
        env:
          CI: true

cards.title: Conditions and Expressions
cards.code:
jobs:
  build:
    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
    steps:
      - name: Checkout code
        uses: actions/checkout@v2
      - name: Run build
        if: github.ref == 'refs/heads/main' # "Run build" step will only execute if the current branch is main.
        run: make build

cards.title: Conditions and Expressions
cards.code:
jobs:
  test:
    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
    steps:
      - name: Checkout code
        uses: actions/checkout@v2
      - name: Run tests
        if: github.event_name == 'pull_request' # "Run tests" step is executed only when the workflow is triggered by a pull request event
        run: npm test

cards.title: Concurrency
cards.body:
The concurrency field creates a group based on the `github.head_ref`. If a new run starts within the same concurrency
group, it cancels any in-progress runs.

cards.title: Concurrency
cards.code:
jobs:
  my_job:
    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
    concurrency:
      group: ${{ github.head_ref }}
      cancel-in-progress: true
    steps:
      - name: Run a script
        run: echo "Running script..."
